articles.title: How the Broncos quickly overcame the Russell Wilson disaster to become a contender

articles.title: NFL Films' deleted Branch video draws Lions' ire
articles.summary: Lions players took offense to an NFL Films video that was released, then deleted, on social media involving suspended safety Brian Branch, claiming it was overly critical.

articles.title: Cowboys' Diggs out Sunday after home accident
articles.summary: The Cowboys will be without cornerback Trevon Diggs on Sunday against the Commanders after an accident at his home Thursday put him in the concussion protocol.

articles.title: 49ers to start Jones vs. Falcons; Purdy out again
articles.summary: Niners coach Kyle Shanahan said Mac Jones will step into the starting quarterback role again against Atlanta as Brock Purdy's return from a toe ailment will have to wait at least another week.

articles.title: Raiders' Bowers doubtful; WR Meyers in question
articles.summary: Raiders tight end Brock Bowers returned to practice Friday but is still doubtful to play because of a knee injury. Receiver Jakobi Meyers is also questionable with knee and toe injuries.

articles.title: Chiefs WR Rice 'sharp' in practice ahead of debut
articles.summary: Chiefs receiver Rashee Rice performed well in his first practice week since finishing his six-game suspension, setting himself up to play a sizable number of snaps in Sunday's game against the Raiders.

articles.title: Cincy hopes benching gets Taylor-Britt 'to respond'
articles.summary: The Bengals made cornerback Cam Taylor-Britt a healthy scratch for the team's 33-31 win over the Pittsburgh Steelers on Thursday -- although they hope that inspires him to "go on a great run here."

articles.title: WR McCloud leaves Falcons for 'private' matter
articles.summary: The Falcons have sent wide receiver Ray-Ray McCloud III home, and he will not play against the 49ers.

articles.title: Cards vague on Murray status; Harrison cleared
articles.summary: Cardinals coach Jonathan Gannon was vague Friday when addressing the health of QB Kyler Murray and his status for Sunday. Also, WR Marvin Harrison Jr. did not appear on the team's injury report, meaning he has cleared the concussion protocol.
